sentences.en: "I'm not a journalist," said Mary Ann crisply.
sentences.cn: “我不是记者，”玛丽·安干脆地说道。

sentences.en: a news story manufactured by an unscrupulous journalist
sentences.cn: 一位不道德的记者编造的一篇报道
一位著名的新闻记者兼播音员

sentences.en: Godfrey had the makings of a successful journalist.
sentences.cn: 戈弗雷具有成为一名成功记者的潜质。

sentences.en: He claimed to be a journalist, and he got around.
sentences.cn: 他自称是一名记者，经常四处游历。

sentences.en: He daydreams of being a famous journalist.
sentences.cn: 他幻想着自己成为著名记者。

sentences.en: He was an excellent journalist and a very fine man.
sentences.cn: 他是位杰出的记者，为人也非常正派。

sentences.en: He was in large part a journalist and propagandist.
sentences.cn: 他很大程度上是个新闻记者和宣传者。

sentences.en: He was the complete all-round journalist.
I believe that a journalist should be completely objective.
sentences.cn: 我认为新闻记者不应当有丝毫偏见。

sentences.en: I had a burning ambition to become a journalist.
sentences.cn: 我热切期盼成为一名记者。

sentences.en: I'd had a few notions about being a journalist.
sentences.cn: 我以前曾有过想当记者的念头。

sentences.en: Michael Cross is a freelance journalist.
sentences.cn: 迈克尔·克罗斯是一名自由新闻记者。

sentences.en: No self-respecting journalist would ever work for that newspaper.
sentences.cn: 凡有自尊心的记者都不会为那家报纸工作。

sentences.en: She had taken him for a journalist.
The journalist did not want to reveal the identity of his informant.
sentences.cn: 那个新闻工作者不想透露消息提供人的身份.

words.tran_cn: 新闻业的，新闻工作者的
新闻业，新闻工作；报章杂志
报界人士,新闻工作者,报纸撰搞人,受雇而代为作文

trans.tran_en: someone who writes news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio
